basics.name: Shantanu Kulshreshth
basics.label: PhD Candidate, School of Geography, Earth and Atmospheric Sciences
basics.summary: My doctoral research looks at young Muslim people's everyday navigations of converging crises of Hindu Nationalism, unemployment, and social change in India. I have conducted over 14 months of ethnographic fieldwork in the North Indian city of Saharanpur and am currently in the process of writing my thesis.

courses: Funded under ARC Project: Youth and the Politics of Liberalism in India.
Supervisors: Prof. Craig Jeffrey (Principal Supervisor) and Prof. Jane Dyson (Co-Supervisor)
Thesis title: The Revolution Will Be Tweeted: Bhim Army and Social Media Mobilisation.
Recipient of Rosey Blue Foundation Scholarship.

education.institution: University of Delhi, Kirori Mal College

work.name: Sparx Centre for Livelihood Research
work.summary: Prepared a handbook on Indian Politics and Governance and reports on unemployment, labour, youth, and agricultural incomes in India.
highlights: Prepared a handbook on Indian Politics and Governance
Prepared reports and briefs on unemployment, labour, youth, and agricultural incomes in India

work.name: Centre for Policy Research
work.summary: Managed the Uttar Pradesh taskforce for interdepartmental research coordination before the 2022 elections and undertook independent fieldwork.
highlights: Managing the Uttar Pradesh taskforce to coordinate interdepartmental research before the 2022 elections
Undertaking independent fieldwork based research on political families and local political economy

work.name: Albert Hirschman Centre on Democracy
work.summary: Worked with Professor Shalini Randeria on the 'Everyday State in India' at the Graduate Institute, Geneva.

work.name: Trivedi Centre for Political Data
work.summary: Compiled caste data for MLA Candidates in Madhya Pradesh (1962-2018)
